snippet: While rating systems have specific formulas, it is worth noting that many of the top schools have selective admissions or are in wealthy communities.
abstract: Michael Winerip On Education column contends that high school rankings published by Newsweek and other organizations strongly favor elite, selective schools in wealthy communities; argues that lists overlook schools that truly improve the lives of underprivileged students.
lead_paragraph: While rating systems have specific formulas, it is worth noting that many of the top schools have selective admissions or are in wealthy communities.

headline.print_headline: In Lists of Best High Schools, Numbers Don’t Tell the Whole Story
headline.seo: In Best High Schools Lists, Numbers Don’t Tell All
headline.main: In Lists of Best High Schools, Numbers Don’t Tell the Whole Story
